org.wtc.eclipse.draw2d.tester
Class FigureTester

java.lang.Object
  org.wtc.eclipse.draw2d.tester.FigureTester

public class FigureTester
extends java.lang.Object

Legacy automated test support for low level UI "events" to be issued to Draw 2D figures.

public void clickFigure(IUIContext ui,
                        FigureCanvas parent,
                        IFigure target)
Move the mouse to the figure with given parent canvas and click it once in the center with mouse button 1.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
parent - - The owner of the target label
target - - The label figure to click

clickFigure

public void clickFigure(IUIContext ui,
                        FigureCanvas parent,
                        IWidgetLocator locator,
                        IFigure target)
Move the mouse to the figure with given parent canvas and click it in the center with mouse button 1.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
locator - - With Window Tester 2.0, the widget locator is also the manager of how a widget will be selected (for example, the ButtonLocator will handle the button.click() and verify the widget has been properly received the click event). The locator also handles the waitForIdle() logic to make sure the UI is free to return from this UI operation. For some UI operations (like launching Swing dialogs), the wait for idle must be a loose interpretation (rather then the classic wait for a syncExec ping to return). Use this parameter to override the selection and/or waitForIdle logic or provide null if the default selection & waitForIdle logic is to be used.
parent - - The owner of the target label
target - - The label figure to click

The locator also handles the waitForIdle() logic to make sure the UI is free to return from this UI operation. For some UI operations (like launching Swing dialogs), the wait for idle must be a loose interpretation (rather then the classic wait for a syncExec ping to return). scrollForClick

public Point scrollForClick(FigureCanvas parent,
                            org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Point clickPoint)
scrollToVisible - Scroll the viewport to place the given point center of the viewport (or as far as the viewport will allow if the given point can't be scrolled to the center).

Returns:
Point - The point to click on the parent figure canvas *after* the viewport has been scrolled. The provided click point should not be used after calling this method

scrollForClick

public Point scrollForClick(FigureCanvas parent,
                            IFigure figure)
scrollForClick - Scroll the viewport to place the given point center of the viewport (or as far as the viewport will allow if the given point can't be scrolled to the center).

Returns:
Point - The point to click on the parent figure canvas *after* the viewport has been scrolled. The provided click point should not be used after calling this method

scrollForClick

                            org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Rectangle bounds)

Returns:
Point - The point to click on the parent figure canvas *after* the viewport has been scrolled. The provided click point should not be used after calling this method

toFigureCanvas

public Rectangle toFigureCanvas(IFigure figure)
Calculate the canvas-relative bounds of the given figure.

Parameters:
figure - - Figure to find the bounds of
Returns:
Rectangle - The bounds of the given figure relative to the figure canvas that owns it
